name: BonTMINLP
brief: Base class for Mixed-Integer Nonlinear Programs (MINLP)

algorithms.name:
MINLP Problem Interface (Binary/Integer Variables with NLP Structure)

Defines the TMINLP interface for specifying optimization problems of the form:
@f[
\begin{array}{rl}
  \min & f(x) \\
  \text{s.t.} & g^L \le g(x) \le g^U \\
              & x^L \le x \le x^U \\
              & x_i \in \{0,1\} \text{ for } i \in \mathcal{B} \\
              & x_i \in \mathbb{Z} \text{ for } i \in \mathcal{I}
\end{array}
@f]

Users implement this interface to define their MINLP problem. Key methods:
- get_nlp_info(): Problem dimensions and sparsity
- get_variables_types(): Identify binary/integer/continuous variables
- get_bounds_info(): Variable and constraint bounds
- eval_f(), eval_grad_f(): Objective and gradient
- eval_g(), eval_jac_g(): Constraints and Jacobian
- eval_h(): Hessian of the Lagrangian

The TMINLP2TNLP adapter converts this to an Ipopt-solvable TNLP by
relaxing or fixing integer variables.

see: BonTMINLP2TNLP.hpp for TMINLP to TNLP conversion
IpTNLP.hpp for Ipopt's NLP interface (parent of continuous relaxation)
